About Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails

We are a family-run tour operator specializing in off-the-beaten-path, Karen hilltribe style nature hikes in the scenic hills of northern Thailand. We're dedicated to ethical tourism and sustainability. Our office is based in Chiang Mai, Thailand, and we look forward to taking you on your next adventure.

From our family to yours, join us on an incredible adventure.

Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails was founded by Khun Mit and his wife Kischa. They started these trails with the dream to give people a chance to experience real authentic hiking trails, visit hilltribe villages and experience the culture of northern Thailand hilltribes in the same way they enjoy so much.

Our Impact

Supporting family run business and sustainable, responsible companies.

With our treks and hilltribe experiences, we hope to empower ethnic hilltribe and local families like us and their communities, by taking our guests out to enjoy authentic jungle experiences, which promote sustainable, ethical tourism and give back to these indigenous families by hiring only local guides and porters who will then train through us to finally get their tour guide licenses. Also staying in a farm stay (Doi Inthanon Trail) that we have been working on with the local Karen Hilltribe community through skills development, building and farmstay management. This will help create more jobs, help the younger generation and older, have more skills and another means of income when they are unable to farm.

Our Guides

Mit and his fellow Karen guides have a deep knowledge of the rainforest and how to live in the mountains. Join them to completely immerse yourself and hike in the beauty of northern Thailand.

Sak

Sak is one of the younger brothers of founder Mit. He grew up with his brothers in their Karen hilltribe village in Chiang Dao. Having grown up in the jungle, he is very knowledgeable about the the rainforests and always shares this intimacy with our guests. He has been a trekking guide for many years and his great sense of humour makes every trek a fun experience.

Det

Det is the youngest brother of Sak and founder Mit. He naturally followed in the foot steps of his older brothers as tour guiding opened up a lot of doors for him. He is a licensed guide in not only in Chiang Mai but other parts of the Thailand too. Like all our brothers, Det has a great sense of humour and lots of knowledge to share with everyone along our trails. He makes everyone feel comfortable and well taken care of, and he is also a great cook!

Lek

Lek is also from the same Karen hilltribe village in Chiang Dao as Sak, Det, and Mit. He is our veteran guide, having led tours and trek in northern Thailand for more than 10 years. He has an absolute WEALTH of knowledge and loves to talk about Thai and Karen culture and history as well as share his jungle wisdom and love of nature. He speaks superb English and is a laid back guide who makes everyone feel comfortable and well taken care of.

Yod

Yod is one of our youngest and newest guides, hailing from a Karen village in Doi Inthanon. He has been with us for over a yearwhile working to achieve his trekking license. Yod is a favorite of families that have kids as he always has everyone laughing at his antics and the games he creates along our trails, using all that nature has to offer as a tool for fun. His family is part of our skills development program and farmstay we take guests on our 2 Day Doi Inthanon Trail to.

Practicing sustainable tourism and supporting family run businesses
